item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数升至10个月新高
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数增至 10 个月来的最高点，表明劳动力市场状况有所缓解。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased to a 10-month high last week, pointing to easing labor market conditions.】

item.title: 美国 5 月生产者价格意外下跌
item.description: 由于能源成本下降，5 月份美国生产者价格意外下跌，这再次表明通货膨胀在第一季度飙升之后正在减弱。【原文：U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fell in May amid lower energy costs, another indication that inflation was subsiding after surging in the first quarter.】

item.title: NHIndustries 与北约签署 6 亿欧元直升机升级协议
item.description: 总部位于法国的 NHIndustries 公司与北约直升机管理机构（NAHEMA）签署了一份价值超过 6 亿欧元（6.4818 亿美元）的合同，开发 NH90 军用直升机的升级版。【原文：NHIndustries has signed a contract worth more than 600 million euros ($648.18 million) with the NATO helicopter management agency (NAHEMA) to develop an upgrade of the NH90 military helicopter, the France-based group said.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求强劲，博通公司业绩飙升
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）周四大涨超过 13%，原因是其乐观的年度预测凸显了对用于支持以人工智能为重点的技术的芯片的无限需求，而其宣布的股票拆分也让市场更加兴奋。【原文：Broadcom surged more than 13% on Thursday as its upbeat annual forecast highlighted an insatiable demand for chips used in powering AI-focused technology, while its announcement of a stock split added to the euphoria.】

item.title: 雷诺瞄准运动型电动汽车以提高利润
item.description: 法国汽车制造商雷诺周四推出了一款电动跑车，这是该公司计划推出的一系列高端电动汽车中的第一款，它可以帮助雷诺抵御来自中国的迫在眉睫的竞争，并在这一市场表现优于其他市场的类别中抢占份额。【原文：French automaker Renault presented an electric sports car on Thursday, the first in a planned range of premium EVs, which could help it fight off looming competition from China and grab share in a category outperforming the rest of the market.】

item.title: 亚利桑那州撞车事故后，Waymo 召回 672 辆自动驾驶汽车
item.description: Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 公司周四表示，将召回 672 辆自动驾驶汽车，因为今年 5 月该公司的一辆无人驾驶汽车在亚利桑那州凤凰城撞上了一根木质电线杆。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo said Thursday it would recall 672 of its self-driving vehicles after one of its driverless vehicles struck a wooden utility pole in Phoenix, Arizona in May.】

item.title: 中国吉利对欧盟关税决定表示失望，誓言采取 "必要措施 "维护权益
item.description: 中国汽车制造商吉利汽车（GEELY.UL）周四对欧盟决定提高中国产电动汽车关税表示 "非常失望"，并誓言采取 "一切必要措施 "维护自身合法权益。【原文：Chinese automaker Geely (GEELY.UL) on Thursday expressed "great disappointment" in the European Union's decision to increase tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles, vowing "all necessary measures" to safeguard its legitimate rights.】

item.title: 外国信用卡交易为委内瑞拉增加了稀缺的美元流通量
item.description: 委内瑞拉政府为控制两位数的通货膨胀率，锁定了汇率，四位公共部门和金融界人士说，用外国信用卡支付的交易正在帮助更多的外汇在委内瑞拉流通。【原文：Transactions paid with foreign credit cards are helping circulate more foreign currency in Venezuela, where the government has locked in an exchange rate as part of efforts to control double-digit inflation, four public sector and finance sources said.】

item.title: 3M 将向 Met Tower Life Insurance 转移约 25 亿美元的美国养老金债务
item.description: 3M 公司周四表示，将向 Metropolitan Tower Life Insurance 公司转移约 25 亿美元的美国养老金支付义务以及近 2.3 万名美国退休人员和受益人的相关计划资产。【原文：3M said on Thursday it would transfer about $2.5 billion of its U.S. pension payment obligations and related plan assets for nearly 23,000 U.S. retirees and beneficiaries to Metropolitan Tower Life Insurance.】

item.title: 独家报道高盛旨在将私人银行富裕客户的贷款额度翻番
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）私人银行业务负责人告诉路透社，该公司的目标是在未来五年内将其向账户规模超过 1,000 万美元的超富裕私人银行客户提供的贷款增加一倍，因为该公司将收集更多存款来增加贷款。【原文：Goldman Sachs aims to double its lending over the next five years to ultra-wealthy private bank clients with account sizes exceeding $10 million, as it gathers more deposits to supercharge lending, the bank's private banking chief told Reuters.】

item.title: 纳斯达克期货大涨，科技股涨势抵消了美联储的谨慎态度
item.description: 尽管美联储预计今年只会降息一次，但市场对美联储在 9 月份放宽利率的押注基本未变，受此影响，重量级科技股上涨，周四纳斯达克指数期货大涨。【原文：Futures tracking the Nasdaq leapt on Thursday on gains in heavyweight technology stocks, aided by broadly unchanged bets on the Federal Reserve easing interest rates in September despite the central bank projecting just one cut this year.】

item.title: 受关税影响，特斯拉预计将提高中国制造汽车在欧盟的售价
item.description: 特斯拉汽车制造商周四在其网站上表示，由于欧盟将对中国制造的汽车征收进口关税，特斯拉预计将提高Model 3的价格，但没有说明涨价的幅度。【原文：Tesla expects to increase the price of its Model 3 because of import duties to be levied by the E.U. on cars made in China, the carmaker said on its website on Thursday, without specifying the size of the price hike.】

item.title: 如何让你的日子更有成效
item.description: 说到生产力，你会想到什么？【原文：When you think of productivity, what comes to mind?】

item.title: 在新的预测中，美联储似乎将退出大选周期
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会可能刚刚躲开了总统竞选活动的聚光灯，一组新的预测显示，在大选日之后才有可能降息。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve may have just ducked out of the presidential campaign spotlight with a fresh set of forecasts showing no interest rate cuts are likely until after Election Day.】

item.title: 咆哮的凯蒂猫对 GameStop 的预测大多未能实现
item.description: 2020 年夏天，当基思-吉尔在 YouTube 视频中讨论 GameStop 时，他认为该公司的未来远比市场预期的要好。将近四年后的今天，他依然看好这家公司，尽管他的大多数重要预测都没有实现。【原文：When Keith Gill appeared on a YouTube video in the summer of 2020 to discuss GameStop , he argued that the company's future was far rosier than the market expected. Nearly four years later, he remains bullish, even if most of his key predictions have gone unfulfilled.】

item.title: 美联储翌日
item.description: Dhara Ranasinghe 展望未来一天的市场。【原文：A look at the day ahead in markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.】

item.title: 瑞银将美联储降息预期推迟至 12 月
item.description: 瑞银全球研究公司（UBS Global Research）表示，它现在预计美联储将在 12 月而不是 9 月开始降息，而高盛（Goldman Sachs）和摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）则继续预计美联储将在 9 月首次降息。【原文：UBS Global Research said it now expects the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates in December instead of September, while Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley continue to expect the first cut in September.】

item.title: 中国企业保留要求调查欧盟猪肉和乳制品的权利
item.description: 周四，当被问及是否有行业组织游说中国企业对欧洲乳制品和猪肉进口进行反补贴和反倾销调查时，中国商务部表示，中国企业保留要求进行反补贴和反倾销调查的权利。【原文：Chinese firms reserve the right to request anti-subsidy and anti-dumping investigations into European dairy and pork imports, the country's commerce ministry said on Thursday, when asked whether industry groups were lobbying it to do so.】

item.title: 美国最大石油贸易集团将提起诉讼阻止拜登推动电动汽车发展
item.description: 包括埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）和雪佛龙（Chevron）在内的美国最大的石油贸易集团 该集团表示，将于本周四提起联邦诉讼，寻求阻止拜登政府为减少汽车和轻型卡车的地球变暖排放以及鼓励电动汽车制造所做的努力。【原文：The nation's largest oil trade group, which includes Exxon Mobil and Chevron , will file a federal lawsuit on Thursday seeking to block the Biden administration's efforts to reduce planet-warming emissions from cars and light trucks and encourage electric vehicle manufacturing, the group said.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车股因担心中国关税反应而进一步下跌
item.description: 欧洲最大的一些汽车制造商周四进一步下跌，原因是他们担心中国将如何应对欧盟委员会对进口中国电动汽车征收的新关税，以打击他们所说的中国政府的过度补贴。【原文：Some of Europe's biggest carmakers fell further on Thursday on concerns over how China will respond to new tariffs the European Commission slapped on imported Chinese electric cars in a bid to combat what they say is excessive subsidies from Beijing.】

item.title: 微软总裁将就安全漏洞向众议院小组作证
item.description: 微软总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）将于本周四在众议院国土安全小组作证，就过去一年俄罗斯和中国黑客入侵微软系统后公司的安全措施接受质询。【原文：Microsoft President Brad Smith will testify before a House of Representatives panel on homeland security on Thursday, fielding questions about the company's security practices after Russian and Chinese hackers breached its systems over the past year.】

item.title: 对马斯克关于为其 560 亿美元特斯拉薪酬方案投票的帖子的反应
item.description: 这位亿万富翁周三在社交媒体上表示，特斯拉股东将投票批准其首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：Tesla shareholders are voting to approve a $56 billion pay package for its CEO Elon Musk by wide margins, the billionaire said on social media on Wednesday.】

item.title: 三星首席执行官李在镕讨论与 Meta、亚马逊和高通公司的合作
item.description: 三星电子周四表示，公司董事长本周与 Meta、高通和亚马逊的负责人会面，讨论合作事宜，议题包括人工智能、云服务和芯片。【原文：Samsung Electronics said on Thursday its chairman met with the heads of Meta , Qualcomm and Amazon this week to discuss cooperation and that topics included artificial intelligence, cloud services and chips.】

item.title: BRC 首席执行官表示，Shein 在加入英国零售集团时承诺致力于可持续发展和劳工问题
item.description: 快时尚集团 Shein 的行业机构负责人告诉路透社，该集团在获准加入英国零售商协会（BRC）时，承诺参与解决可持续发展和道德劳工政策等问题。【原文：Fast-fashion group Shein committed to engage on issues including sustainability and ethical labour policies when it was allowed to join the British Retail Consortium (BRC), the head of the industry body told Reuters.】

item.title: 迄今为止，美国豪华旅行社对奥运的需求不旺
item.description: 到目前为止，美国的豪华旅行社对巴黎奥运会的需求不旺，因为富裕的游客会选择附近的欧洲旅游目的地。【原文：Luxury travel agencies in the United States are so far seeing lackluster demand for the Paris Olympics, as wealthier travelers instead opt for nearby destinations in Europe.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称淡马锡将与壳牌敲定 Pavilion Energy LNG 资产出售交易
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，新加坡淡马锡控股公司正在敲定向壳牌出售液化天然气（LNG）贸易公司Pavilion Energy的部分资产，交易将在未来几天内完成。【原文：Singapore's Temasek Holdings is finalising the sale of some assets from liquefied natural gas (LNG) trading firm Pavilion Energy to Shell with a deal set to be completed in the coming days, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: Stellantis 力争明年提高股息率
item.description: 世界第四大汽车制造商 Stellantis 周四维持了 2024 年的财务预测，并表示明年将提高股息支付率。【原文：Stellantis , the world's fourth-largest automaker, on Thursday maintained its 2024 financial forecasts and said it aimed to improve its dividend payout next year.】

item.title: 马斯克说服特斯拉投资者支持他的薪酬。现在他必须说服法官
item.description: 特斯拉似乎已经说服了一大批小型投资者和大型基金批准埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。现在，更难的部分来了：说服已经持怀疑态度的特拉华州法官予以认可。【原文：Tesla appears to have convinced an army of small investors and major funds to ratify Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package. Now comes the harder part: persuading an already skeptical Delaware judge to recognize it.】

item.title: 美联储会议、良性通胀让软着陆希望不灭
item.description: 在令人鼓舞的通胀数据和美联储对抑制消费物价取得的进展表示肯定之后，今年推动美国股市软着陆的希望得到了提振。【原文：Soft landing hopes that have powered U.S. stocks this year received a boost following encouraging inflation data and a nod from the Federal Reserve at progress made in fighting consumer prices.】

item.title: Alphabet 因涉嫌追踪浏览器遭奥地利隐私权投诉
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四遭到奥地利权益组织 NOYB 的投诉，称其 Chrome 浏览器涉嫌跟踪用户，而这一问题早已进入欧盟反垄断监管机构的视线。【原文：Alphabet's Google was hit with a complaint by Austrian advocacy group NOYB on Thursday for allegedly tracking users of its Chrome Web browser, an issue already on EU antitrust regulators' radar.】
